summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Haiti, particularly resolution 2476 (2019) which established the United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti (BINUH), decides to extend the mandate of BINUH, headed by a Special Representative of the Secretary-General, until 15 October 2021, in accordance with resolution 2476 (2019), and reiterates the essential role of Haiti's Parliament and the need for inclusive national dialogue to address instability and organize free, fair, and transparent legislative elections; The Security Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
